title: How to Start a Teddy School With a Lot of Teddies

steps.headline: You will need over 10 teddies, dolls, and/or stuffed animals you want.
Ask the bear, doll, or stuffed animal's owners what their names are.
steps.description: Welcome them with a large hug. This will be very important for other steps.

steps.headline: Make a roll or attendance list.
steps.description: Write down all your teddies, dolls, and/or stuffed animals' names on the computer or by yourself. Write them down in alphabetical order; e.g, Brian then Caramel because b then c. This will help you keep the names organized.

steps.headline: Get a notebook and get all the info about your teddies, dolls, and/or stuffed animals.
steps.description: Include birthdays, allergies and interests. Plan out the whole week; for real teachers, this is like a to-do list.

steps.headline: Write subjects in your notebook.
steps.description: Like if one subject is Art, write what they draw or paint like- Space is good.

steps.headline: Then, if you like, you can make cards for all of them; e.g: Dear John, welcome to teddy school.
steps.description: Hope you enjoy your prep year! Love, (insert your name here).

steps.headline: When it's one teddy, doll, or stuffed animal's birthday, make a cupcake and lolly bags and have the class sing or say "Happy Birthday"!
When they do work, don't make it hard.
steps.description: Set up easy sums or whatever subject you're doing.

steps.headline: Put up work you do together on the wall of wherever you hold classes.
If you have instruments, they would be useful for Music class!
Make days fun and enjoyable so it would make you want to go to teddy/doll/stuffed animal school!
Remember to have fun and don't give your teddies, dolls, and/or stuffed animals detention!

text: You will need over 10 teddies, dolls, and/or stuffed animals you want.  Ask the bear, doll, or stuffed animal's owners what their names are. Welcome them with a large hug. This will be very important for other steps. Make a roll or attendance list. Write down all your teddies, dolls, and/or stuffed animals' names on the computer or by yourself. Write them down in alphabetical order; e.g, Brian then Caramel because b then c. This will help you keep the names organized. Get a notebook and get all the info about your teddies, dolls, and/or stuffed animals. Include birthdays, allergies and interests. Plan out the whole week; for real teachers, this is like a to-do list. Write subjects in your notebook. Like if one subject is Art, write what they draw or paint like- Space is good. Then, if you like, you can make cards for all of them; e.g: Dear John, welcome to teddy school. Hope you enjoy your prep year! Love, (insert your name here). When it's one teddy, doll, or stuffed animal's birthday, make a cupcake and lolly bags and have the class sing or say "Happy Birthday"!  When they do work, don't make it hard. Set up easy sums or whatever subject you're doing. Put up work you do together on the wall of wherever you hold classes.  If you have instruments, they would be useful for Music class!  Make days fun and enjoyable so it would make you want to go to teddy/doll/stuffed animal school!  Remember to have fun and don't give your teddies, dolls, and/or stuffed animals detention!  Have recess and lunch too!
